title: how to correctly handle a change in the data dir
body:
hi,

i am quite unsure if this is really an issue, but i am in need of advice here:

i have moved my oc installation to a new server, on that, the filesystem layout has changed. i did not do anything else but changing the datadir config variable. it seems, that this change had a few strange effects, first, looking at the oc_storages table, i get this:

```
mysql> select * from oc_storages;
+-------------------------------------------------------+------------+
| id                                                    | numeric_id |
+-------------------------------------------------------+------------+
| local::/var/xxxxxxx/xxxxxxx/xxxxx/data/user1/        |          1 |
| local::/var/xxxxxxx/xxxxxxx/xxxxx/data/user2/        |          2 |
| local::/var/xxxxxxx/xxxxxxx/xxxxx/data/admin/         |          3 |
| local::/var/www/xxxxxxx/xxxxxxx/xxxxx/private/user1/ |          4 |
| local::/var/www/xxxxxxx/xxxxxxx/xxxxx/private/user2/ |          5 |
| home::admin                                           |          6 |
+-------------------------------------------------------+------------+
```

interestingly, there are still files accociated to the old storage locations, as i am getting errors like the following in the oc log, appearantly from the antivirus engine:

```
{"app":"files_antivirus","message":"scanning file : files\/clientsync\/somefilename.xlsx","level":0,"time":"2013-11-17t11:44:03+00:00"}
{"app":"php","message":"fopen(\/var\/<old location>\/data\/ludwig\/files\/clientsync\/somefilename.xlsx): failed to open stream: no such file or directory at \/var\/www\/clients\/client1\/web27\/web\/lib\/files\/storage\/local.php#146","level":2,"time":"2013-11-17t11:44:03+00:00"}
{"app":"files_antivirus","message":"file could not be open.","level":3,"time":"2013-11-17t11:44:03+00:00"}
```

is there anything i have to do after moving the storage to a new location, if yes, what?


best regards,
torben nehmer

btw: is it possible, that this is somehow related to the redownload-bug of the csync tool (https://github.com/owncloud/mirall/issues/994) i am not sure if the redownloading also happened on the old server.
